monogr.title: Most approued, and long experienced vvater-vvorkes : Containing, the manner of winter and summer-drowning of medow and pasture, by the aduantage of the least, riuer, brooke, fount, or water-prill adiacent; there-by to make those grounds (especially if they be drye) more fertile ten for one. As also a demonstration of a proiect, for the great benefit of the common-wealth generally, but of Hereford-shire especially. By Rowland Vaughan, Esquire
monogr.author: Vaughan, Rowland

keywords.term: Agriculture, viticulture, texts on hunting, veterinary science

div.head: In praise of the Worke and Author.
div.l: TO praise a worke of such a worth as this,
That shews the way t'inrich both earth & man:
Deserues a witt that rare and excellent is,
And all to short, excell in what it can.
The Author, and his worke do merit fame;
VVith-out the glory of a Poets name.
